body:
My $800 iPhone 6+ Became a $800 dollar paper weight. I was victim of the cruel #BendGate
I saw no apparent bend, but apple employees told me that there was an LCD hardware error, which basically means my phone doesn't respond to touch, and white lines cover the phone screen. Upon that, the phone randomly selects things whenever I turn it on. I am going to talk to my insurance provider to see if I can get a replacement, even though my one year warranty is up. Wish me luck :(
body_tagged:

Wish me luck :(

replies.body:
Welcome to Apple!

Once I went to the apple store because my old ads iPhone 4's lick button was stuck. The guy told us to wait and me and my dad waited for around 45 minutes. Guy comes back without saying a word, holding an iPad with the screen showing us all the available iPhone 4s. LOL, they can't even fix a broken lock button.

Sorry for spelling mistakes I'm on my phone rn and too lazy to fix xd

replies.body:
Similar situation happened to me too.

My phone screen was coming off and there was rainbow lines on it and I couldn't type on it or anything, so I took it in. We waited about 3 hours and they said that they couldn't fix it due to reliability since everything fell out of my phone when they took the whole screen off, so they decided to give me a whole new phone.

replies.body:
I'm in love with Apple. All of my products are Apple:
1) Apple TV
2) MacBook Air 
3) IPod touch 4/5/6
5) iPod shuffle 
6) IPhone 5s
7) IPad mini
8) IPhone 5C
They are all working awesome except my 5C. Doesn't see the SIM card. But rest is awesome!

replies.body: Pc isn't better, Mac isn't better. They are the same but it depends on your own idea which one to buy. I personally think that Mac is easier to use, comfortable. That's the true one for me. I've never said that pc is bad as I used pc too, but Mac fits better with me.
